title: Basic Rock Beat
description: Learn the foundational rock drum pattern using kick, snare, and hi-hat.

steps.title: The Rock Beat
steps.description: The basic rock beat is the most common drum pattern in popular music. It uses three sounds: Kick drum (the low thump), Snare drum (the sharp crack), and Hi-hat (the ticking cymbal).

steps.title: Hit the Kick
steps.description: Find and hit the Kick drum pad (KCK).
steps.hint: The Kick drum is the red pad labeled KCK.

steps.title: Hit the Snare
steps.description: Now hit the Snare drum pad (SNR).
steps.hint: The Snare is the orange pad labeled SNR.

steps.title: Hit the Hi-Hat
steps.hint: The Closed Hi-hat is the green pad labeled CHH.

steps.title: Kick + Hi-Hat Together
steps.description: Play the Kick and Closed Hi-hat at the same time. This is beat 1 of the rock pattern.
steps.hint: Hit both KCK and CHH simultaneously.

steps.title: Snare + Hi-Hat Together
steps.description: Play the Snare and Closed Hi-hat together. This is beats 2 and 4 of the rock pattern.
steps.hint: Hit both SNR and CHH simultaneously.
